name: buildkite-mcp-server
description: Official MCP Server for Buildkite - Connect Claude to your Buildkite CI/CD pipelines
long_description: The Buildkite MCP Server enables Claude to interact with your Buildkite CI/CD infrastructure. Manage pipelines, trigger builds, monitor job status, view logs, download artifacts, and analyze test results directly from Claude. Perfect for DevOps workflows, build automation, and CI/CD pipeline management.

tools.name: create_pipeline
tools.description: Set up a new CI/CD pipeline in Buildkite with YAML configuration, repository connection, and cluster assignment

tools.name: list_pipelines
tools.description: List all pipelines in an organization with their basic details, build counts, and current status

tools.name: get_pipeline
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific pipeline including its configuration, steps, environment variables, and build statistics

tools.name: update_pipeline
tools.description: Modify an existing Buildkite pipeline's configuration, repository, settings, or metadata

tools.name: list_clusters
tools.description: List all clusters in an organization with their names, descriptions, default queues, and creation details

tools.name: get_cluster
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific cluster including its name, description, default queue, and configuration

tools.name: get_cluster_queue
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific queue including its key, description, dispatch status, and hosted agent configuration

tools.name: list_cluster_queues
tools.description: List all queues in a cluster with their keys, descriptions, dispatch status, and agent configuration

tools.name: list_builds
tools.description: List all builds for a pipeline with their status, commit information, and metadata

tools.name: get_build
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific build including its jobs, timing, and execution details

tools.name: get_build_test_engine_runs
tools.description: Get test engine runs data for a specific build in Buildkite. This can be used to look up Test Runs.

tools.name: create_build
tools.description: Trigger a new build on a Buildkite pipeline for a specific commit and branch, with optional environment variables, metadata, and author information

tools.name: current_user
tools.description: Get details about the user account that owns the API token, including name, email, avatar, and account creation date

tools.name: user_token_organization
tools.description: Get the organization associated with the user token used for this request

tools.name: get_jobs
tools.description: Get all jobs for a specific build including their state, timing, commands, and execution details

tools.name: get_job_logs
tools.description: Get the log output and metadata for a specific job, including content, size, and header timestamps

tools.name: list_artifacts
tools.description: List all artifacts for a build across all jobs, including file details, paths, sizes, MIME types, and download URLs

tools.name: get_artifact
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific artifact including its metadata, file size, SHA-1 hash, and download URL

tools.name: list_annotations
tools.description: List all annotations for a build, including their context, style (success/info/warning/error), rendered HTML content, and creation timestamps

tools.name: list_test_runs
tools.description: List all test runs for a test suite in Buildkite Test Engine

tools.name: get_test_run
tools.description: Get a specific test run in Buildkite Test Engine

tools.name: get_failed_executions
tools.description: Get failed test executions for a specific test run in Buildkite Test Engine. Optionally get the expanded failure details such as full error messages and stack traces.

tools.name: get_test
tools.description: Get a specific test in Buildkite Test Engine. This provides additional metadata for failed test executions

tools.name: access_token
tools.description: Get information about the current API access token including its scopes and UUID

BUILDKITE_API_TOKEN.title: Buildkite API Token
BUILDKITE_API_TOKEN.description: Your Buildkite API token with appropriate permissions for pipeline and build management
